body: this task will get someone's attention soon
@yegor256 thanks a lot for reporting, **15 mins** added to your acc, pmt ID `000-b06e0fac`

@yegor256 I managed to modify the code so that an e-mail saved to a file looks good on my machine. Before I create a pull request I want to make sure that it works for you as well.

Please download the file from https://www.evernote.com/shard/s35/sh/23b09f0a-1650-43f7-ab98-f8b11edd73d5/9a0520de1820d366ec1747731eecb45a , open it in Thunderbird or Outlook and tell me, if you can see the `привет` lettering.

The file has following contents.

```
From: from <test-from@jcabi.com>
To: to <test-to@jcabi.com>
Message-ID: <10449826.1.1420722385672.JavaMail.DP118M@DP118M-PC>
Subject: test subject: test me
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative; 
    boundary="----=_Part_0_25400955.1420722385519"

------=_Part_0_25400955.1420722385519
Content-Type: text/html;charset="utf-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

<html><body>=D0=BF=D1=80=D0=B8=D0=B2=D0=B5=D1=82</body></html>
------=_Part_0_25400955.1420722385519--
```
@dpisarenko Yes, this `eml` file looks correct to me
@dpisarenko did you manage to reproduce the bug (in a unit test)?
@dmarkov I added a pull request with the bugfix ( https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-email/pull/13 ). Please find someone to review it.
@dmarkov @yegor256 Please assign someone to review my pull request. Thanks!
